revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins: Insights from Deep Drilling Results
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of passive continental margins and the impact of deep drilling results on our understanding of sedimentary processes and facies. The author emphasizes the importance of oceanographic, tectonic, and climatic controls in determining facies successions on continental slopes and rises. The study provides new evidence on the role of gravity-controlled mechanisms, such as turbidity currents and debris flows, in sediment transport on these margins.
